benchmark_details.name: MultiChallenge
benchmark_details.overview: MultiChallenge is a pioneering benchmark evaluating large language models (LLMs) on conducting multi-turn conversations with human users, focusing on realistic challenges in human-LLM interactions.
benchmark_details.data_type: multi-turn conversation history with user instructions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the multi-turn conversational capabilities of large language models and to identify their challenges in engaging with human users.

data.source: Synthetic data generated through a multi-agent system and human-reviewed.

methods: LLM as judge with instance-level rubrics
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the responses of LLMs to user prompts across various challenge categories within the benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in respect to multi-turn conversation challenges.
methodology.baseline_results: Claude 3.5 Sonnet achieved an average accuracy of 41.4% on MultiChallenge.
methodology.validation: Evaluation methods are validated through comparison with human-rated outcomes.

harm: Difficulty in accurately following user instructions across multiple turns.
